body.p: Customizing the PDF output requires knowledge of CSS, Paged Media, and DITA. The following list provides some resources to help you:

ul.li: CSS - You can find a good tutorial here: . Also, the specification is available on the W3C website: .

CSS Paged Media - This is a part of the CSS specification that shows how to organize your publication in pages, how to use headers/footers, page breaks, and other page-related issues. The specification is available here: . Also, there is a set of hands-on examples in the Oxygen PDF Chemistry user guide: .

DITA - You will need a basic understanding of DITA elements, attributes, and structure. A good resource is The DITA Style Guide - Best Practices for Authors by Tony Self. It is available at: www.ditastyle.com and: .
